name: Bazil Meade: A Boy, A Journey, A Dream (book)
description:
The story of Bazil Meade and The London Community Gospel Choir

Bazil's journey has taken him from the cotton fields of Montserrat to the 2009 FA Cup Final where LCGC performed the FA Cup hymn. He was born into poverty and a life without hope but found his future fulfilled through his calling to music. Bazil left the Caribbean and came to England at 9. A difficult relationship with his stepfather led to his leaving home at age 13 and moving in with his pastor who suggested he take up music. She prayed and laid hands on him and by the end of the evening he could play the piano. Within a fortnight he was performing in public. 

To this day, Bazil still can't read music and plays purely by instinct. He has worked with most of the greats - from Daman Albarn (Blur) to Beverly Knight - and the book carries some impressive endorsements.


Get your copy of Bazil Meade's book at the special LCGC price of only £7.49 (RRP £9.99)

Author: Bazil Meade
Format: Paperback
ISBN: 9781854249982
Published: 23 September 2011
Publisher: Monarch Books

name: Bazil Meade: A Boy, A Journey, A Dream
description:
After the successful release of Bazil Meade's new book "A Boy, A Journey, A Dream", Bazil went into the studio and recorded acoustic versions the songs which he used for the chapter title of the book. The songs are mostly self-penned by Bazil himself and each one has it's own special meaning to his life experiences.

Songs include:

1) Constant is His Love
2) Found Myself A Reason
3) Glory to The Son
4) Where Could I Go
5) Stand Up
6) Back in The Fold
7) Let My People Go
8) Long Long Lonely Journey
9) Keep Moving

All tracks performed by Rev Bazil Meade an features singers from the London Community Gospel Choir.

name: Gospel Greats
description:
This is traditional Gospel at its best and is still one of our best sellers since the 1980's!

The album captures the eclectic sounds of the 80's and features unique interpretations of classic Gospel songs such as Amazing Grace and Kumbayah. This Album will appeal to old and new fans of Gospel, classical and soul music.

6 - Kumbayah

8 - Love Lifted Me
9 - When The Saints Go Marching In
10 - There is a Green Hill Far Away
11 - Oh Happy Day
12 - The Old Rugged Cross

name: The Edge
description:
The Edge of LCGC is just that... 'edgy'! Featuring the creme-de la creme of LCGC it is a fresh and modern approach to their Gospel sound. 

With self-penned songs such as 'Keep Moving' and 'God is Love', this album will have you dancing with Joy and will also make you reflective. There are classical, salsa, rock and jazz influences fused with attention demanding vocals providing a clear reason why LCGC are still cutting edge 30 years on!

1. Intro
2. The Answer
3. I Need Your Spirit
4. Found Myself a Reason
5. Difference in Me
6. Dance
7. Ark
8. Born Again
9. He Loves Me Lots
10. Magic
11. Praise Worthy
12. Never Alone
13. Keep Moving
14. God is Love

name: Glorious
description: This Glorious album by the Nation's Favourite Choir is evidence of the power and beauty of the human voice. On their first ever crossover album, the London Community Gospel Choir showcase their extraordinary voices, glorious harmonies and stunning arrangements, mixing classic songs Let It Be, Now That We Found Love, Hallelujah and U2's One with some of the most enduring inspirational anthems, such as Amazing Grace, Abide With Me, Swing Low, Sweet Chariot and We Shall Overcome.
